borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify">2.&nbsp;<span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development, by reason of its excessive scale, siting on the boundary, and unneighbourly design, coupled with the orientation of the site, would&nbsp;result in an increased sense of overbearing,&nbsp;a harmful loss of outlook, and undue loss of daylight and sunlight&nbsp;to No.21 Hunters Square. The proposal would constitute an unneighbourly form of development contrary to:</span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt"> - National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021) </span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt"> - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span><br></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify">​​​​​​​<span style="font-size:11pt;">1. The proposed development, by reason of its excessive depth&nbsp;and width, extending across the original dwellinghouse&nbsp;and side extension&nbsp;would cause&nbsp;undue harm to the character and appearance of this property when viewed from the rear.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:11pt"></span><span style="font-size:11pt">The cumulative impacts of the works at the property would form an overdevelopment of the site, resulting in massing and bulking to the rear. The proposal is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<br></span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension
